content: on github, I'm "watching" the rust-analyzer repo so that I get a notification email whenever there is a new release. However, github is sending me a lot of email every night. For example, last night I received 45 emails about the "Pre-release nightly -- nightly". Does anyone know what's up with this?

Yeah, it's partly my fault. There are two things:

  • uploading the final artifacts to GitHub fails very often. The workflow retries up to 10 times, but deletes the partial release (it should only retry the files that fail to upload, but that's not trivial because you need to make sure they don't exist), but this isn't enough and I've seen it fail 2-3 times in a row.
  • today I was trying to make https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/11026 work, without great success

The first one above is worse with https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/10483, because we have more artifacts now, thus a larger chance for the upload to fail. But it's been steadily getting worse for the past couple of months.
hmm. Failing uploads from a github runner to github itself? Is there an upstream issue with github about this?
(but good to know that this a known issue, thanks!)
I still think there's something really wrong going on for it to fail this often, but.. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
